1.1.1.1.2. src.exporters.seas5.s5 module¶

class src.exporters.seas5.s5.S5Exporter(pressure_level: bool, granularity: str = 'monthly', data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'), product_type: Optional[str] = None, dataset: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.exporters.cds._CDSExporter

An exporter for S5 data from the Climate Data Store

Parameters

  • data_folder – path to the data folder (where data will be stored)

  • variable – the variable that you want to download.

  • pressure_level – Do you want data at different atmospheric heights? If True, data is downloaded from all pressure levels. If `False, only single level data is used

  • granularity – The granularity of data being pulled. ‘hourly’/’pressure_level’ data has a forecast for every 12hrs (12, 24, 36 …) ‘hourly’/’single_level’ data has a forecast for every 6hrs (6, 12, 18, 24 …) ‘monthly’ data has a forecast for every month {1 … 6}

  • product_type – The product type is only valid for monthly datasets. It corresponds to the post-processing of the monthly forecasts. If None is given, Defaults to ‘monthly_mean’. It can be one of {‘ensemble_mean’, ‘hindcast_climate_mean’, ‘monthly_mean’}. If pressure_level is False, it can additionally be {‘monthly_standard_deviation’, ‘monthly_maximum’, ‘monthly_minimum’}

  • dataset – The dataset to pull the data from. If none is passed, this is inferred from all the other information

export(variable: str, min_year: int = 1993, max_year: int = 2019, min_month: int = 1, max_month: int = 12, max_leadtime: Optional[int] = None, pressure_levels: Optional[List[int]] = None, n_parallel_requests: int = 3, show_api_request: bool = True, break_up: bool = True)¶

Export S5 data from the Climate Data Store

Parameters

  • variable – the variable that you want to download

  • min_year – The minimum year of your request

  • max_year – The maximum year of your request

  • min_month – The minimum month of your request

  • max_month – The maximum month of your request

  • max_leadtime – The maximum leadtime of your request. If granularity is hourly then provide in days. If granularity is monthly then provide in months. If None is passed, defaults to 3 months / 90 days

  • pressure_levels – Pressure levels to download data at

  • n_parallel_requests – The number of parallel requests to initialise

  • show_api_request – Whether to print the API request

  • break_up – bool: Whether to break up requests
